intro: Dalechampia brevipes var. triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaf dalechampia, is a species native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with lance-shaped leaves that are often trifoliate, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
